History of Federalism
2. History of Federalism

A wide-spread interest among political philosophers in topics
concerning the centralised nation state have fuelled attention to
historical contributions on unitary sovereignty. However, we can also
identify a steady stream of contributions to the philosophy of
federalism, also by those more well known for their arguments
concerning centralised power (cf. Karmis and Norman 2005 for such
readings). Much of the Western literature on federalism has focused on
the unit of states. To underscore this bias, consider first some
non-Western practices and theories of federal features.
